title: Practical Optimization of Mg-Li Alloys for Lightweight Material Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational materials science, basic mechanical engineering principles, and understanding of statistical analysis
context.additional_context: Advanced training course for working professionals focusing on acquiring practical material design methodology

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively analyze the impact of alloy design factors (KAFs) on UTS, EL, and CR in Mg-Li alloys.
Learners can optimize alloy composition and process conditions using machine learning models (GBR).
Learners can select suitable elements (Al, Si, Ca, Zn, etc.) for alloy design by interpreting SHAP analysis results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
